title: Check the status of tenant onboarding
content:
After performing the steps for tenant onboarding, you must check the onboarding job status to verify if the tenants were onboarded sucessfully.

To check the onboarding status in IDM

To verify whether all common services tenants are onboarded successfully:

  1. Login to IDM portal.
  2. On the ORGANIZATIONS page, click the tenant tile.
  3. Verify that ODL, UIS, and AutoPass are added in the Application field.

To check the onboarding status in OPTIC Data Lake

Perform the following steps to get the status of a tenant operation:

  1. Get the IDM token for a user with SUPER_IDM_ADMIN. 
    kubectl -n <namespace> get secret op-secret  --template={{.data.idm_integration_admin_password}} | base64 -d


curl -X POST https://<HOST>:<PORT>/idm-service/v3.0/tokens?includePerms=true -H 'content-type: application/json' -d '{"passwordCredentials":{"username":"username","password":"password"},"tenantName":"idmOrgName"}' --ca-cert </etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt>
  2. Perform the TMS API call to onboard a tenant using the IDM token retrieved in Step 1 as value to the X-Auth-Token parameter in the request. 
    curl -X GET "https://<HOST>:<PORT>/itom-data-ingestion-tenant-mgmt/urest/v1/tenants/<tenant_id>/tenant-jobs/<tenant_deploy_jobId>" --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header "X-Auth-Token:<IDM token>" --ca-cert </etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt>
  3. Check the job_status, if the job_status is successful, the tenant onboards to pulsar, Vertica, and ODL Services. The OPTIC Data Lake specific roles are created in IDM.
  4. If the job_status is failed,  use the tenant specific GET API to find the reason for failure. To view the status of a specific tenant: 
    curl -X GET "https://<HOST>:<PORT>/itom-data-ingestion-tenant-mgmt/urest/v1/tenants/<tenant_id>" --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header "X-Auth-Token:<IDM token>" --ca-cert </etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt>

    where, the "X-Auth-Token" is the IDM token retrieved in Step 1.

To check the onboarding status in Operations Cloud

After creating tenants in Operations Cloud, ensure that you can log into the system with the respective tenant name as specified in the URL. Following is the URL example:

https://<domainname>:<port>/bvd?tenant=<tenant_name>

If you're able to access the URL, the tenants are onboarded successfully in UI Services.

Also, ensure that UIS is added in the Application field in IDM portal.

To check the onboarding status in AutoPass

After creating tenants in AutoPass, ensure that you are able to access the following AutoPass portal URL with the tenant username and password.
 

https://<HOST>:<PORT>/autopass/ls/login?tenant=<tenant_name>

If you're able to access the URL, the tenants are onboarded successfully in AutoPass.
